label: Description
value: Oblong cover embroidered along all four sides in a geometric pattern. Diamond shapes filled with floral motifs are embroidered in red with metallic thread accents.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk on linen, metallic lace Technique: cross stitch embroidery

label: Description
value: White linen apron pleated into a narrow band at the top. The sides and lower half of the apron are decorated with squares of cut work with needle-lace fillings alternating with squares embroidered in white in a stylized plant motif. The bottom is trimmed with scalloped needle lace.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: plain weave, embroidered with cutwork and needle lace fillings Label: linen embroidered with cutwork and needle lace fillings

label: Description
value: Long white panel embroidered in a small allover design of lacy festoons and small flowers. The long festoons have drawn centers.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: deflected element work

label: Description
value: White panel embroidered in a small allover design of lacy festoons and small flowers. The lacy festoons have drawn centers.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: deflected element work

label: Description
value: Oblong table cover of dark green silk bordered with green net in an appliqued design of foliage in reversed scrolls that terminate in lilies. Applique is natural colored linen embroidered in dark yellow silk. Edged with natural colored needle lace.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, linen Technique: appliqué on gauze weave, needle lace

label: Description
value: Brilliant yellow satin ground with a profuse symmetrical design of silver, rose and ivory blossoms and serrated leaves in vases.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: compound satin with supplementary weft

label: Provenance
value: ex-collection: Mrs. George T. Bliss, Vitali Benguiat Collection.

label: Description
value: Gold ground patterned in leaf green with large symmetrical trophies of foliage and blossoms enclosed within ogives of boldly scrolling leaves and surmounting festoons of pomegranates centering on a cinquefoil.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, linen Technique: compound satin (brocatelle)

label: Provenance
value: ex-collection: Mrs. George T. Bliss, Vitall Bequiat

label: Description
value: Wide border of tan-colored silk embroidered in a floral pattern and detached allover floral sprigs. Colors are faded and now are dull red, blue and gold.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: chain stitch embroidery

label: Description
value: Canary yellow ground showing a design in ivory of diapered scrolls forming ogives and enclosing floriated leaf palmettes.

label: Description
value: Two lengths of blue moire with selvages in pink and yellow.

label: Description
value: Violet silk faille with fine symmetrical moire on either side of a central fold. Violet silk warp with dark green silk weft.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: rib weave (faille) with moire

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 227.3 x 47 cm (7 ft. 5 1/2 in. x 18 1/2 in.)

label: Description
value: Street scene, Egyptian Hall at right, Patent Office on Old Bond Street at left.  Installation of water system is shown at right.  People looking up at two ballons in the sky.

label: Physical description
value: Carved ivory inlaid with carved mother-of-pearl and carved and stained ivory, gilded overlay

label: Description
value: Cylindrical box, rounded at bottom and slightly flaring. Cover flat, with rounded edge. Brown lacquer with grass straws in gold and relief dots in gold and silver. Relief mark on bottom.

label: Description
value: Cylindrical box with cover, made of a segment of a bamboo stem. Ferns in gold 'hira-makiye' lacquer on ground of 'shunkei-nuri' (reddish-brown) lacquer. The depressions in top and underneath are due to formation of the node of the bamboo segment. The ferm is a symbol associated with Japanese New Year's ceremonies.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 7 x 5.1 cm (2 3/4 x 2 in.)

label: Description
value: Enameled and gilt metal figurine of bald-pated man holding brass decanter and wine glass. Enameled costume: royal blue jacket with tan belt, blue waistcoat with red buttons, green breeches, white stockings, black shoes. Threaded pin for support on base of left foot.

label: Description
value: Metal figurine of bald-pated man with top knot holding bow and brown enamel violin with gold strings and edging. Enameled costume: green jacket with gray blet, royal blue waistcoat with gold buttons, light blue breeches, white stockings with red and yellow mottling, black shoes. Threaded pin on base of left foot. Traces of gilding on neck, throat and violin bow.

label: Description
value: Small picture, framed, and under glass. Shows figure of woman, kneeling before an altar, while an angel bends over her, pointing an arrow at her breast. Above, dove descending on rays of light. whole in architectural frame with canopy above. Embroidered in colored silks and some metal thread; appears to be laid work on a paper foundation. Faces and hands of engraved paper. Below: "S. Teresa da Jesus."

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal threads, paper Technique: painted, metal threads laid on parchment or paper with wax

label: Description
value: Slender gallipot shape, with green and white dragon pursuing the flaming pearl, in aventurine enamel, on a blackground of blue, scrolled with silver wire. Neck and foot mounted in brass. Yellow counterenamel.

label: Description
value: Inrō (container) in form of a turtle, with tail and feet drawn in and head partially extended. Divided into four horizontal compartments fitted into each other and lacquered black on inside. Strung on brown silk cord with turtle-shaped Ojime 1952-164-24 and Netsuke 1952-164-25.

label: Description
value: Five sections, with an elephant and three flying birds in rubbed lacquer (togidashi), gold, silver, and red on black (ro-iro) background.  Inside gold nashiji lacquer.  Mounted with ojime 1952-164-36 and netsuke 1952-164-37. Bliss 11776, See 1952-164-32.

label: Provenance
value: 1952: acquired by Museum from Anonymous donor

label: Description
value: Head of a monkey, with gold eyes.

label: Description
value: Figure of a street vendor, wearing a sambaso hat and carrying a box on straps around his neck. The head is loosely set into the neck. Mounted with inro 1952-164-35 and ojime 1952-164-36. Bliss no. 1225. See 1952-164-35.

label: Description
value: Black lacquer inro, oval in section, decorated with gold waves and flowers. Tied and braided cord.

label: Provenance
value: 1952: acquired by Museum from Anonymous donor

label: Description
value: Rectangular box, with rounded corners, of wood. Sides and tops covered with applied flowers carved in mother-of-pearl and tinted ivory. Silver bands around edge of box and cover. Inside bottom "nashiji" (pear ground) lacquer.

label: Physical description
value: Shibayama technique carved mother-of-pearl and tinted ivory, silver, lacquered wood

label: Description
value: (a) Ovid body with fluting at top and bottom. Beaded vertical scroll handles fastened to body with twin leaves and berries. Fluted and foliated spigot with bone handle. Engraved coat of arms: Parter per fess, gules, two mullets and sun in its splendor; azure, a citadel with two towers; impaled with argent, a chevron azure, three holly leaves slipped, vertical. (b) High, concave cover, with bulging fluted top and flame finial.

label: Provenance
value: 1952: acquired by Museum from Anonymous donor

label: Description
value: Cylindrical cup on three ball feet. Lower part, repousse shells and leaves; upper two thirds engraved with strapwork and scrolls with masks of crowned woman, turbaned, bearded man and faun. Three engraved ovals, with woman standing amidst waves (Aphrodite), a fairy-like winged woman, faun with thunderbolt.  Domed cover with repousse band of shells and leaves, and ball knob.

label: Description
value: Blue and white jasperware baluster shapes, pierced longitudinally for passage of cord. Dipped jasperware, decorated with row of lancette leaves and four bows connected with swags. Yellow silk cord.

label: Description
value: Cylindrical body on spreading foot. Green ground with sprig decoration showing off-white relief decoration of classical figure groups.

label: Description
value: Horizontal oval plaque of solid blue jasperware, with darker blue slip and white relief, showing three putti pulling and coaxing a goat. A fourth putto carries grapes. Oblong black and gilt wooden frame with cut-out oval set with glass.

label: Physical description
value: Molded and tinted stoneware (Jasperware), wood, glass

label: Description
value: Vertical oval plaque, pale blue solid jasper body with darker slip and white relief showing a youth, nude except for drapery falling from shoulder. He stands in left profile and hold bowl in one hand. In black and gilt frame.

label: Description
value: Iridescent blue, purple and yellow. Free-blown body, depressed sphere in shape, somewhat squared in plan. Heavy, rolled-over rim from squarish opening, drawn irregularly down and attached to applied heavy double threads, accenting four “corners” of body, and diminishing to points, near bottom. Depressed center on underside.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 6 x 9 cm (2 3/8 x 3 9/16 in.)

label: Provenance
value: 1952: acquired by Museum from Anonymous donor

label: Description
value: Iridescent blue, purple and green glass. Free-blown ovoid shape with flattened shoulders. Short neck, about one third diameter of body, flares slightly. Body decorated in upper half with bands of five rosettes composed of five applied drop petals each, in depressions, and entire band is edged by applied thread at upper and lower edges.

label: Provenance
value: 1952: acquired by Museum from Anonymous donor

label: Description
value: Flat iron strip, wound to form a hollow vertical spiral, and terminating in a hook at the top. Inside, a candle socket, the projecting pin of which runs in the spiral opening to regulate the height of the candle. Dome circular wooden base.

label: Description
value: Mazarin blue damask with design of lateral rows of curving peony branches with diapered foliage alternating with floral vases. Faded pink and white satin selvages.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 205.7 x 184.2 cm (6 ft. 9 in. x 6 ft. 1/2 in.); dimensions reflect three components stitched together.

label: Description
value: Brilliant yellow ground woven in cherry red with symmetrical design of alternating rows of upstanding floral shrubs surmounted by pairs of opposed birds. Wide yellow cloth selvedges. Lined; striped silk fringe.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain compound cloth

label: Description
value: Green damask with a large flower in foliate scrolls with cornucopia-like shapes.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: 4&1 satin damask; background is the warp float face of the satin

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft (a): 91.5 x 54 cm (36 in. x 21 1/4 in.) Warp x Weft (b): 94.5 x 54 cm (37 3/16 x 21 1/4 in.) Repeat H: 100 cm (39 3/8 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Ex-collection: Mrs. George T. Bliss and Vitali Benguiat (see Benguiat Collection, Sales Catalog, American Art Association, February 25, 1905, no. 498.

label: Description
value: Panel of linen embroidered in silk and metallic thread showing a central escutcheon framed by a laurel wreath. Above the escutcheon are the raised initials PPS and ACU in silver thread over padding. Smaller wreath in the lower left hand corner embroidered in silver thread with the following motto: La Beauté Vertu L'Honneur Flambequx D'Un Grand Coeur. At the lower right corner: Coeur Et Courage Font L'Ouvrage. Outer border pattern shows large floral sprays.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metallic embroidery, linen foundation Technique: embroidered in satin, outline and counted stitches

label: Provenance
value: Ex-collection: Grant B. Schley, New York.
